items.title: Alleged drone attack on a Putin residence offers the Kremlin a timely narrative shift
items.standfirst: Russia has accused Ukraine of targeting one Putin's presidential palaces with drones in a bid to disrupt peace talks. Analysts say it may have been engineered.
items.content: Russia has accused Ukraine of targeting one Putin's presidential palaces with drones in a bid to disrupt peace talks. Analysts say it may have been engineered.

items.title: Bitter recriminations between Russia, Ukraine as war eclipses peace push
items.standfirst: Kremlin says alleged drone attack on presidential residence - called a fabrication by Kyiv - will affect peace talks.
items.content: Kremlin says alleged drone attack on presidential residence - called a fabrication by Kyiv - will affect peace talks.

items.title: Have Russian claims of Ukraine attack on Putin home ended hopes for peace?
items.standfirst: Ukrainian President Zelenskyy denies that Kyiv attacked the Novgorod residence of Russian President Putin.
items.content: Ukrainian President Zelenskyy denies that Kyiv attacked the Novgorod residence of Russian President Putin.

items.title: Russia offers no proof that Ukraine targeted Putin residence in drone attack
items.standfirst: The Kremlin said on Tuesday that it could not prove its claim that Ukrainian drones targeted one of President Vladimir Putin's residences because the drones were all "shot down". Moscow accused Ukraine of launching 91 long-range drones at Putin's home in the Novgorod region in what it called a "personal attack against Putin", vowing to retaliate.
items.content: The Kremlin said on Tuesday that it could not prove its claim that Ukrainian drones targeted one of President Vladimir Putin's residences because the drones were all "shot down". Moscow accused Ukraine of launching 91 long-range drones at Putin's home in the Novgorod region in what it called a "personal attack against Putin", vowing to retaliate.

items.title: Ukraine denies drone attack on Putin's residence
items.standfirst: Russia has accused Ukraine of targeting a presidential residence, which President Zelensky called "typical Russian lies".
items.content: Russia has accused Ukraine of targeting a presidential residence, which President Zelensky called "typical Russian lies".

items.title: Alleged strikes on Vladimir Putin residence 'not good', Trump says
items.standfirst: Donald Trump said he was "very angry" to hear reports of an alleged Ukrainian drone strike on one of Vladimir Putin's state residences in Russia.
items.content: Donald Trump said he was "very angry" to hear reports of an alleged Ukrainian drone strike on one of Vladimir Putin's state residences in Russia.

items.title: Russia threatens Ukraine after alleged attack on Putin's residence
items.standfirst: Russia on Monday promised to retaliate against Ukraine after it said nearly 100 drones had targeted one of President Vladimir Putin's residences, likely throwing a wrench into President Donald Trump’s efforts to end the nearly four-year war."Such reckless actions will not go unanswered.
items.content: Russia on Monday promised to retaliate against Ukraine after it said nearly 100 drones had targeted one of President Vladimir Putin's residences, likely throwing a wrench into President Donald Trump’s efforts to end the nearly four-year war."Such reckless actions will not go unanswered.

items.content: For decades, Zia and ousted PM Sheikh Hasina were bitter rivals - and their feud defined Bangladesh's politics.

items.content: Bangladesh's first female prime minister Khaleda Zia has died following a prolonged illness, her political party has said.

items.title: Khaleda Zia, first female Bangladesh prime minister, dies aged 80
items.standfirst: Zia’s archrivalry with Sheikh Hasina defined the country’s politics for a generationKhaleda Zia, the first female prime minister of Bangladesh whose long rivalry with Sheikh Hasina defined the country’s politics for a generation, has died aged 80.Zia was one of the most significant and divisive political figures in the country since Bangladesh independence 50 years ago. Her death was announced on Tuesday morning by the Bangladesh Nationalist party (BNP). Continue reading...
items.content: Zia’s archrivalry with Sheikh Hasina defined the country’s politics for a generationKhaleda Zia, the first female prime minister of Bangladesh whose long rivalry with Sheikh Hasina defined the country’s politics for a generation, has died aged 80.Zia was one of the most significant and divisive political figures in the country since Bangladesh independence 50 years ago. Her death was announced on Tuesday morning by the Bangladesh Nationalist party (BNP). Continue reading...

clusters.title: Why China is bringing out the big guns for military drills around Taiwan
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump ‘not worried’ as China’s live-fire Taiwan wargame enters second day

items.title: Why China is bringing out the big guns for military drills around Taiwan
items.standfirst: China stepped up its military drills around Taiwan with live-fire exercises on Tuesday, the second day of an operation dubbed “Justice Mission 2025". The massive show of force comes at a crucial time as Beijing seeks to capitalise on domestic political tensions in Taiwan and issue a warning to foreign powers supporting Taipei.
items.content: China stepped up its military drills around Taiwan with live-fire exercises on Tuesday, the second day of an operation dubbed “Justice Mission 2025". The massive show of force comes at a crucial time as Beijing seeks to capitalise on domestic political tensions in Taiwan and issue a warning to foreign powers supporting Taipei.

items.title: China flexes blockade capabilities near Taiwan on second day of military drills
items.standfirst: China's People's Liberation Army is staging a second day of large-scale military drills around Taiwan. It's unleashing live-fire exercises as part of what it calls "Justice Mission 2025."
items.content: China's People's Liberation Army is staging a second day of large-scale military drills around Taiwan. It's unleashing live-fire exercises as part of what it calls "Justice Mission 2025."(Image credit: Chiang Ying-ying)

items.title: Trump ‘not worried’ as China’s live-fire Taiwan wargame enters second day
items.standfirst: US president says Chinese leader did not notify him of drills that have involved live missile launches into Taiwan straitTaiwan-China tensions – explained in 30 secondsDonald Trump has said he is not worried by China’s live-fire military drills surrounding Taiwan and that he has a great relationship with the Chinese leader, Xi Jinping, who “hasn’t told me anything about it”.The US president’s comments came amid a large two-day surprise attack simulation launched by the People’s Liberation Army (PLA) on Monday and Tuesday, which China has called “Justice Mission 2025”. Continue reading...
items.content: US president says Chinese leader did not notify him of drills that have involved live missile launches into Taiwan straitTaiwan-China tensions – explained in 30 secondsDonald Trump has said he is not worried by China’s live-fire military drills surrounding Taiwan and that he has a great relationship with the Chinese leader, Xi Jinping, who “hasn’t told me anything about it”.The US president’s comments came amid a large two-day surprise attack simulation launched by the People’s Liberation Army (PLA) on Monday and Tuesday, which China has called “Justice Mission 2025”. Continue reading...

items.title: China fires a warning to the U.S. and simulates blockade of Taiwan
items.standfirst: China fired rockets, massed assault ships and flew bombers around Taiwan on Tuesday, simulating a military blockade in a warning to the United States against supporting the Beijing-claimed island.
items.content: China fired rockets, massed assault ships and flew bombers around Taiwan on Tuesday, simulating a military blockade in a warning to the United States against supporting the Beijing-claimed island.

items.title: China fires rockets into waters off Taiwan in second day of military drills
items.standfirst: China has fired rockets into the waters off Taiwan on a second day of large-scale war games around the island aimed at rehearsing a blockade.
items.content: China has fired rockets into the waters off Taiwan on a second day of large-scale war games around the island aimed at rehearsing a blockade.

items.title: China launches live-fire drills around Taiwan simulating blockade of major ports
items.standfirst: Taipei condemns exercise that Chinese army calls ‘a stern warning’ against separatist and external forcesChina has launched live-fire military drills around Taiwan, simulating a blockade of major ports, attacking maritime targets, and fending off international “interference”, in what it calls a warning to “separatist” forces in Taiwan.The People’s Liberation Army (PLA) – the military wing of the ruling Communist party in China – sent its navy, air force, rocket force and coastguard to surround Taiwan on Monday morning for a surprise exercise called “Justice Mission 2025”, which began less than an hour after it was announced. Continue reading...
items.content: Taipei condemns exercise that Chinese army calls ‘a stern warning’ against separatist and external forcesChina has launched live-fire military drills around Taiwan, simulating a blockade of major ports, attacking maritime targets, and fending off international “interference”, in what it calls a warning to “separatist” forces in Taiwan.The People’s Liberation Army (PLA) – the military wing of the ruling Communist party in China – sent its navy, air force, rocket force and coastguard to surround Taiwan on Monday morning for a surprise exercise called “Justice Mission 2025”, which began less than an hour after it was announced. Continue reading...

items.title: Anthony Joshua, boxer who defeated Jake Paul, survives deadly car crash
items.standfirst: British heavyweight and Olympic gold medalist Anthony Joshua survived a car crash in Nigeria that killed two other people, authorities said. Joshua escaped with minor injuries, according to police.
items.content: British heavyweight and Olympic gold medalist Anthony Joshua survived a car crash in Nigeria that killed two other people, authorities said. Joshua escaped with minor injuries, according to police.

items.title: A sombre and sobering end to the year - Bunce on fatal crash

items.content: BBC Radio 5 Live's boxing analyst Steve Bunce on the fatal car accident that killed two of Anthony Joshua's close friends.

items.title: Anthony Joshua injured in Nigeria car crash that killed two team members
items.standfirst: The British heavyweight boxer suffered minor injuries in the crash, which killed two team members and close friends.
items.content: The British heavyweight boxer suffered minor injuries in the crash, which killed two team members and close friends.

items.title: Anthony Joshua’s camp confirm two of his close friends died in Nigeria car crash
items.standfirst: British former boxing champion sustained minor injuriesSina Ghami and Kevin ‘Lateef’ Ayodel killed in accidentThe British heavyweight boxer Anthony Joshua has issued a statement after he was injured in a car crash in Nigeria on Monday morning which killed two of his close friends.The former world heavyweight boxing champion was taken to an undisclosed hospital after his car hit a stationary vehicle at about 11am on the Lagos-Ibadan Expressway, the Ogun state police commissioner, Lanre Ogunlowo, said. The driver of Joshua’s vehicle was also injured, he added. Continue reading...
items.content: British former boxing champion sustained minor injuriesSina Ghami and Kevin ‘Lateef’ Ayodel killed in accidentThe British heavyweight boxer Anthony Joshua has issued a statement after he was injured in a car crash in Nigeria on Monday morning which killed two of his close friends.The former world heavyweight boxing champion was taken to an undisclosed hospital after his car hit a stationary vehicle at about 11am on the Lagos-Ibadan Expressway, the Ogun state police commissioner, Lanre Ogunlowo, said. The driver of Joshua’s vehicle was also injured, he added. Continue reading...

items.content: Boxer Anthony Joshua is in a "stable" condition after a car crash in Nigeria - as tributes have been paid to two of his friends who were killed in the collision.

items.standfirst: Traffic was expected to resume gradually on Tuesday afternoon.
items.content: Traffic was expected to resume gradually on Tuesday afternoon.

items.title: Eurostar warns of ongoing delays after services resume
items.standfirst: Passengers detail how they have been left stranded and looking for other routes after power issues in the Channel Tunnel.
items.content: Passengers detail how they have been left stranded and looking for other routes after power issues in the Channel Tunnel.

items.title: Eurostar suspends all Europe trains over power issue during holiday travel
items.standfirst: Eurostar services between London and Europe disrupted as Channel Tunnel undergoes 'technical intervention'.
items.content: Eurostar services between London and Europe disrupted as Channel Tunnel undergoes 'technical intervention'.

items.title: Eurostar services gradually resuming after major power supply issue
items.standfirst: Eurostar said on December 30 it was restarting services over a power supply problem in the Channel tunnel. Travellers were left scrambling to find alternatives after the operator postponed all services between London, Paris, Amsterdam and Brussels. FRANCE 24's Olivia Bizot spoke to some in Gare du Nord in Paris.
items.content: Eurostar said on December 30 it was restarting services over a power supply problem in the Channel tunnel. Travellers were left scrambling to find alternatives after the operator postponed all services between London, Paris, Amsterdam and Brussels. FRANCE 24's Olivia Bizot spoke to some in Gare du Nord in Paris.

items.title: Eurostar: Hundreds of passengers stranded in stations
items.standfirst: Eurostar suspended all trains between London, Paris, Amsterdam and Brussels on Tuesday and advised passengers to postpone their journeys to a later date, citing a power supply problem in the Channel tunnel.
items.content: Eurostar suspended all trains between London, Paris, Amsterdam and Brussels on Tuesday and advised passengers to postpone their journeys to a later date, citing a power supply problem in the Channel tunnel.

items.title: Eurostar cancels all services after power issue
items.standfirst: Eurostar suspended train services in Europe on December 30 after a power supply issue in the Channel tunnel, sparking travel chaos for passengers during the very busy New Year period. Its services to and from London “are suspended until further notice" and the company advised its passengers to rebook their journeys for other days. FRANCE 24's Olivia Bizot tells us more from Gare du Nord in Paris.
items.content: Eurostar suspended train services in Europe on December 30 after a power supply issue in the Channel tunnel, sparking travel chaos for passengers during the very busy New Year period. Its services to and from London “are suspended until further notice" and the company advised its passengers to rebook their journeys for other days. FRANCE 24's Olivia Bizot tells us more from Gare du Nord in Paris.

items.title: Eurostar resumes service through Channel Tunnel after suspending all trains
items.standfirst: The Channel Tunnel operator said traffic should return to normal overnight on Tuesday after Eurostar was forced to suspend trains between London, Paris, Amsterdam and Brussels due to a power supply issue. Some journeys were able to resume in the late afternoon, but many passengers were left stranded in stations, scrambling for alternative modes of transport.
items.content: The Channel Tunnel operator said traffic should return to normal overnight on Tuesday after Eurostar was forced to suspend trains between London, Paris, Amsterdam and Brussels due to a power supply issue. Some journeys were able to resume in the late afternoon, but many passengers were left stranded in stations, scrambling for alternative modes of transport.

items.title: UAE pulls troops from Yemen after rift with Saudi Arabia escalates
items.standfirst: Emirati withdrawal comes after Riyadh said it bombed UAE weapons shipment
items.content: Emirati withdrawal comes after Riyadh said it bombed UAE weapons shipment

items.title: UAE promises to withdraw forces from Yemen after bombing by Saudi Arabia
items.standfirst: Attack was aimed at what Riyadh called a shipment of weapons for separatists backed by UAEThe United Arab Emirates has said it will withdraw its remaining forces in Yemen after tensions with Saudi Arabia escalated over a sweeping offensive by UAE-backed separatists.The Emirati defence ministry announced the withdrawal on Tuesday, hours after Saudi Arabia bombed what it said was a shipment of weapons for Yemeni separatists that had arrived from the UAE. Continue reading...
items.content: Attack was aimed at what Riyadh called a shipment of weapons for separatists backed by UAEThe United Arab Emirates has said it will withdraw its remaining forces in Yemen after tensions with Saudi Arabia escalated over a sweeping offensive by UAE-backed separatists.The Emirati defence ministry announced the withdrawal on Tuesday, hours after Saudi Arabia bombed what it said was a shipment of weapons for Yemeni separatists that had arrived from the UAE. Continue reading...

items.title: An escalation in Yemen threatens to reignite civil war and widen tensions in the Gulf
items.standfirst: Saudi Arabia bombed Yemen's port city of Mukalla, targeting a shipment of weapons from the United Arab Emirates for separatist forces. The UAE later said it would withdraw its forces from Yemen.
items.content: Saudi Arabia bombed Yemen's port city of Mukalla, targeting a shipment of weapons from the United Arab Emirates for separatist forces. The UAE later said it would withdraw its forces from Yemen.(Image credit: Ted Shaffrey)

items.title: UAE to withdraw forces from Yemen amid crisis with Saudi Arabia
items.standfirst: The UAE said Tuesday it would withdraw its remaining forces from Yemen after Saudi Arabia led an airstrike on a southern Yemeni port targeting what it said was a UAE-linked weapons shipment. Following the strike, Saudi Arabia backed calls for UAE forces to leave the country within 24 hours.
items.content: The UAE said Tuesday it would withdraw its remaining forces from Yemen after Saudi Arabia led an airstrike on a southern Yemeni port targeting what it said was a UAE-linked weapons shipment. Following the strike, Saudi Arabia backed calls for UAE forces to leave the country within 24 hours.

items.title: Saudi Arabia calls UAE-backed separatist advance in Yemen threat to national security
items.standfirst: Saudi Arabia declared a UAE-backed separatist advance in Yemen as a threat to Riyadh's national security, after a Saudi-led coalition said it struck a UAE weapons shipment destined to Yemen's STC separatist forces. The latter, backed by Abu Dhabi, are seeking to revive the formerly independent state of South Yemen thirty years after the country's unification. They made sweeping territorial gains after launching a lightning offensive in recent weeks. Jon Gambrell, Associate Press reporter, tells us more.
items.content: Saudi Arabia declared a UAE-backed separatist advance in Yemen as a threat to Riyadh's national security, after a Saudi-led coalition said it struck a UAE weapons shipment destined to Yemen's STC separatist forces. The latter, backed by Abu Dhabi, are seeking to revive the formerly independent state of South Yemen thirty years after the country's unification. They made sweeping territorial gains after launching a lightning offensive in recent weeks. Jon Gambrell, Associate Press reporter, tells us more.

Brian Cole Jr., 30, was…

Brian Cole Jr., 30, was…

items.title: Suspected DC pipe bomber to appear at detention hearing after alleged confession
items.standfirst: Lawyers for Brian Cole argue he should be released ahead of trial for allegedly planting devices in DC in 2021The man accused of planting pipe bombs outside the headquarters of both the Democratic and Republican national committees the night before the January 6 insurrection at the US Capitol is set to appear at a federal detention hearing before a magistrate judge on Tuesday.Earlier this month, authorities arrested Brian Cole Jr, of Woodbridge, Virginia. He has yet to enter a plea. Cole’s lawyers argue that he should be released while he awaits trial, as he does not present any danger. In a recent court filing, they write that Cole has agreed to home detention enforced by GPS monitoring, and will live under the supervision of his grandmother. Continue reading...
items.content: Lawyers for Brian Cole argue he should be released ahead of trial for allegedly planting devices in DC in 2021The man accused of planting pipe bombs outside the headquarters of both the Democratic and Republican national committees the night before the January 6 insurrection at the US Capitol is set to appear at a federal detention hearing before a magistrate judge on Tuesday.Earlier this month, authorities arrested Brian Cole Jr, of Woodbridge, Virginia. He has yet to enter a plea. Cole’s lawyers argue that he should be released while he awaits trial, as he does not present any danger. In a recent court filing, they write that Cole has agreed to home detention enforced by GPS monitoring, and will live under the supervision of his grandmother. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Iran to listen to protesters’ ‘legitimate demands’ after widespread dissent

items.title: Iran to listen to protesters’ ‘legitimate demands’ after widespread dissent
items.standfirst: President calls for talks with leaders of demonstrations caused by decline in currency and living standardsIran’s government has called for dialogue with protest leaders after the country’s largest demonstrations in three years over a plunging currency and declining living conditions.Protests started on Sunday after Iran’s currency fell to a record low against the US dollar, causing traders and shopkeepers to close their stores in downtown Tehran. This was accompanied by mass protests in the capital as well as in major cities, including Isfahan, Shiraz and Mashhad. Continue reading...
items.content: President calls for talks with leaders of demonstrations caused by decline in currency and living standardsIran’s government has called for dialogue with protest leaders after the country’s largest demonstrations in three years over a plunging currency and declining living conditions.Protests started on Sunday after Iran’s currency fell to a record low against the US dollar, causing traders and shopkeepers to close their stores in downtown Tehran. This was accompanied by mass protests in the capital as well as in major cities, including Isfahan, Shiraz and Mashhad. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Winter storm brings heavy snow and strong winds across parts of the US
clusters.neutral_headline: Winter storm brings heavy snow and strong winds across parts of the US

items.title: Winter storm brings heavy snow and strong winds across parts of the US
items.standfirst: Frigid temperatures in Great Lakes, north-east and midwest as tens of thousands face power outages and icy travelA wild winter storm brought strong winds, heavy snow and frigid temperatures to the Great Lakes and north-east on Tuesday, a day after a bomb cyclone barreled across the midwest and left tens of thousands of customers without power.The storm hit parts of the Plains and Great Lakes on Monday with sharply colder air, strong winds and a mix of snow, ice and rain, leading to treacherous travel. Forecasters said it intensified quickly enough to meet the criteria of a bomb cyclone, a system that strengthens rapidly as pressure drops. Continue reading...
items.content: Frigid temperatures in Great Lakes, north-east and midwest as tens of thousands face power outages and icy travelA wild winter storm brought strong winds, heavy snow and frigid temperatures to the Great Lakes and north-east on Tuesday, a day after a bomb cyclone barreled across the midwest and left tens of thousands of customers without power.The storm hit parts of the Plains and Great Lakes on Monday with sharply colder air, strong winds and a mix of snow, ice and rain, leading to treacherous travel. Forecasters said it intensified quickly enough to meet the criteria of a bomb cyclone, a system that strengthens rapidly as pressure drops. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Russia still importing Michelin aviation tyres despite sanctions, records suggest

items.title: Russia still importing Michelin aviation tyres despite sanctions, records suggest
Russia still importing Michelin aviation tyres despite sanctions, records suggest
items.standfirst: Exclusive: Sales via intermediary companies appear to continue despite Michelin’s attempts to cut off tradeRussia has continued to use intermediary companies, including one apparently based in the UK, to import aviation tyres made by the French firm Michelin despite attempts to stop the trade, customs records suggest.Despite sanctions on the sale of civilian and aviation tyres to Russia, which is critically dependent on foreign suppliers, an analysis of records indicates that a significant number are continuing to get through. Continue reading...
items.content: Exclusive: Sales via intermediary companies appear to continue despite Michelin’s attempts to cut off tradeRussia has continued to use intermediary companies, including one apparently based in the UK, to import aviation tyres made by the French firm Michelin despite attempts to stop the trade, customs records suggest.Despite sanctions on the sale of civilian and aviation tyres to Russia, which is critically dependent on foreign suppliers, an analysis of records indicates that a significant number are continuing to get through. Continue reading...

clusters.title: SoftBank to acquire DigitalBridge for $4bn in move to deepen ties to AI
clusters.neutral_headline: SoftBank to acquire DigitalBridge for $4bn in move to deepen ties to AI

items.title: SoftBank to acquire DigitalBridge for $4bn in move to deepen ties to AI
items.standfirst: Acquisition would further expand SoftBank’s investments in artificial intelligence as it tries to center itself in the boomSoftBank Group will acquire digital infrastructure investor DigitalBridge Group in a deal valued at $4bn, the companies said on Monday, as the Japanese investment firm looks to deepen its AI-related portfolio.The acquisition would expand SoftBank’s exposure to digital infrastructure as the Japanese conglomerate is positioning its portfolio to focus on artificial intelligence. SoftBank’s billionaire founder Masayoshi Son is seeking to capitalize on surging demand for the computing capacity that underpins artificial intelligence applications. Continue reading...
items.content: Acquisition would further expand SoftBank’s investments in artificial intelligence as it tries to center itself in the boomSoftBank Group will acquire digital infrastructure investor DigitalBridge Group in a deal valued at $4bn, the companies said on Monday, as the Japanese investment firm looks to deepen its AI-related portfolio.The acquisition would expand SoftBank’s exposure to digital infrastructure as the Japanese conglomerate is positioning its portfolio to focus on artificial intelligence. SoftBank’s billionaire founder Masayoshi Son is seeking to capitalize on surging demand for the computing capacity that underpins artificial intelligence applications. Continue reading...

items.title: SoftBank to Buy DigitalBridge in $3 Billion Data Center Deal
items.standfirst: SoftBank Group Corp. agreed to buy private equity firm DigitalBridge Group Inc. for about $3 billion in cash, part of the Japanese conglomerate’s push to invest in data centers and other digital infrastructure fueling the artificial intelligence boom.
items.content: SoftBank Group Corp. agreed to buy private equity firm DigitalBridge Group Inc. for about $3 billion in cash, part of the Japanese conglomerate’s push to invest in data centers and other digital infrastructure fueling the artificial intelligence boom.

items.title: SoftBank Nears Deal for Data Center Investment Firm DigitalBridge
items.standfirst: SoftBank Group Corp. is in advanced talks to acquire DigitalBridge Group Inc., a private equity firm that invests in assets such as data centers, according to people with knowledge of the matter.
items.content: SoftBank Group Corp. is in advanced talks to acquire DigitalBridge Group Inc., a private equity firm that invests in assets such as data centers, according to people with knowledge of the matter.
